task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 325°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the building's height, I need to see both the ground base and roof peak; currently at pitch 0°, looking up will reveal the roof structure for vertical measurement.
To measure the full height, I need to see both the roof (currently visible at +30° pitch) and the ground base; rotating pitch down by 60° will reveal the building's base for vertical measurement.

With pitch at -60° showing the building's base and prior +30° view showing the roof, the total vertical angle span is 90°; using the 13.4m distance and trigonometry (13.4 * (tan(30°) + tan(60°)) ≈ 31.0m) gives the estimated height.
